description:
The first cour of the fourth season of Dr.STONE.

Senkuu and the Kingdom of Science revive Tsukasa and build a spaceship to reach 'Why Man' on the Moon!

(Source: Crunchyroll News, edited)

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Aviation
tags.description: Regarding the flying or operation of aircraft.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Agriculture
tags.description: Prominently features agriculture practices.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Gambling
tags.description: Centers around the act of gambling.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

title.native: Dr.STONE NEW WORLD 第2クール

alternative: Dr. Xeno Houston Wingfield (Dr. ゼノ・ヒウストン・ウィングフィールド)

name.native: スタンリー・スナイダー

node.description: He won the 7th "Story King" section in Weekly Shonen Jump No.51 2001. His previous works include Any number of times on the 13th of June, Square Freeze and LOVE LOVE Santa, which were published in Big Comic Spirits. He is married to the stage and voice actress [Orie Kimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95940/Orie-Kimoto).

__Current residence:__ Tokyo, Japan

 [Twitter](https://x.com/Boichi_Bo1) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@boichibetoon) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/boichibetoon/)

Intended to be a manga artist from his childhood days, Mujiki Park aka Boichi majored college in physics as preparation to draw science fiction works and also to learn the technology of performance and imaging. He went on to graduate school to major in image technology.
In 1993, while still enrolled, he debuted in a Korean shoujo manga magazine. Since then, he is gaining popularity releasing a number of works, and publishing books on how to draw manga targeting a wide range of reader. He also published books focusing on the art of manga as well as the use of computer assisted tools.

He rejoins Japan in 2004 and steps into the world of Japanese manga with Space Chef Caisar published in the monthly Comic Gum. Since then he published many manga and one-shots.

In 2005, he publishes Lovers in Winter. A compilation of 9 out of his 11 hentai oneshots serialized in the adult magazine Comic Aun.

In 2006, he publishes 2 scifi oneshots: Hotel (Lucca 2011’s award for Best Oneshot) and Present, both in the magazine Morning. Along with All for the Tuna, Stephanos and Diadem, they’ll be compiled in 2008 in the Hotel tankoubon.

Sun-Ken Rock was in 2006 his first long serialization, becoming his flagship series until its completion in 2016. It was published in the bi-weekly magazine Young King by Shonen Gahosha. Several spin-off were also published in Young King such as one focusing on Yumin in 2011 or Pickaxe in 2012. A third one titled Feed Yumin was published monthly in 2012 in the Monthly Young King of Shonen Gahosha.

Boichi was also the artist of Raqiya written by YAJIMA Masao and published chez Kodansha from 2008 to 2010 as well as for the Terra Formars Asimov spin-off of 2016 published by Shueisha. Similarly, he was the artist of the oneshots Brutality by Takeda Yuusuke in 2007 and eques by Kengo Miyatani i 2012.

Boichi is also an accomplished humanitarian. As to express his sentiment toward Vietnam and apologize for Korea’s action during the war, Sun-Ken Rock volume 2’s royalties were donated to the NPO Children of Vietnam. Among other actions, he also initiated actions such as Korean mangakas drawing a support page for Japan’s 2011 March 11th Tōhoku earthquake by giving the royalties to the Red Cross. It’s also with the will to help the reconstruction of Japan following this traumatic event that he begins at the end of 2011 up till 2013 the publication of H.E the Hunt for Energy in Shueisha’s Jump X magazine.

He never fails to show his support to the Freedom of Speech and liberty as he did for the events of Paris Terror Attacks or during the Refugee Crisis.

Boichi’s manga are firstly published in Japanese but some are also available in a variety of languages such as French, Italian, German, Spanish, Thai, English, Korean and Chinese, showing the always growing interest of the world in his work.
[Twitter](https://x.com/doremifaeiga)
Originating from [Tezuka Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/200/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/txa2xt2a)

__Graduated:__ Tokyo College of Music

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cut_tatsu7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tatsuya__kato/)
__Kurasumi Sunayama__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter.
[Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/hiroakitsutsumi) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiroaki850605)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉原俊一郎)

Affiliated with studio Bihou.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mocchi_0422)
Composite artist affiliated with Asahi Production.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__[Profile (Exhibition of Music)](https://www.yukikanesaka-woh.tokyo/about)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yukikanesaka)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kanesaka.yuki)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yukikanesaka)__

__Residency:__ Boston, Massachusetts
__Graduated:__ Ichihara Chuo High School, Seiwa University, Berklee College of Music

__Yukihiro Kanesaka__ is a Japanese musician, multi instrumentalist, producer, DJ, beat maker, assistant professor, composer and member of hip-hip group [Hybrid Thoughts](https://anilist.co/staff/162625).

 He goes by the alias Yuki Kanesaka when producing, monolog as a multi instrumentalist, and DJ U-KEY when beatmaking, additionally he works as an assistant professor at Berklee College of Music.

**Genres:** Hip-hop, Funk, Jazz

__[Website](https://alienlibertyinternational.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ALI_MUSIC_DANCE)__ | __[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnYvfe8YHnRRly5SCA8mP5A)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2Qqrew4ZcEwf9NY7UqWGfU)__

__Introduction:__
ALI, otherwise known as Alien Liberty International, is a multinational hip-hop/funk band led by vocalist [Reo Imamura](https://anilist.co/staff/158752/Reo-Imamura), otherwise known as Leo. The band has its roots all over earth, from Japan to Europe, the United States to Asia, Africa and other countries.

Their first single *"Wild Side"* was chosen as the opening theme to the anime [*BEASTARS*](https://anilist.co/anime/107660). A year later, their second single *"Lost in Paradise"* featuring rapper [AKLO](https://anilist.co/staff/191499/) was chosen as the ending theme to the anime [*Jujutsu Kaisen*](https://anilist.co/anime/113415).

The band announced an indefinite hiatus on May 14, 2021 following the arrest and indictment of member Kahadio. They also announced his contract termination from the band the same day.  As a result, the band was dropped from performing the opening theme *"Teenage City Riot"* for the anime [*Subarashiki Kono Sekai The Animation*](https://anilist.co/anime/120376) before it began airing. Half a year later on Nov 18, following their indefinite hiatus, the band announced they would resume activities.

__Members:__
- [Reo Imamura](https://anilist.co/staff/158752/Reo-Imamura) (今村怜央), better known as Leo – leader, vocalist
- [Luthfi Kusuma](https://anilist.co/staff/158776/Luthfi) (楠間ルッフィ), better known as Luthfi – bassist
- [Alexander Taiyou Fidel](https://anilist.co/staff/158775/Alex) (アレクサンダー・タイヨウ・フィデル), better known as Alex – percussionist
- [Aiichirou Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/192971) (田中愛一朗), better known as Cesar – guitarist

__Former Members:__
- [Jua](https://anilist.co/staff/158751/Jua) – rapper
- [Zeru](https://anilist.co/staff/158774/Zeru) – guitarist
- [Kadio Shirai](https://anilist.co/staff/158772/Kahadio) (白井カディオ), better known as Kahadio – drummer
- [Yuu Hagiwara](https://anilist.co/staff/158777/Yu) (萩原優), better known as Yuu/Yu – saxist
- [Jin Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/158773/Jin) (井上仁), better known as Jin – keyboardist/pianist

[Official Site](https://www.brei.men/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/BREIMEN_JP) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@BREIMENChannel) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@breimen_jp)

Five-piece alternative funk band signed to Sony Music Labels.
Tyler Walker is an ADR Director, Script writer and voice actor for FUNimation.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Jigglypuffntron)
__Mike McFarland__ is an American voice actor, ADR Director, Script, and Line Producer at Funimation Entertainment.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zachbolton6)

Also a line producer.

[Profile](https://www.cl20.jp/portal/activity/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/reraku) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_sxCGl2slqyAj9i26KLKuA)

Science writer and talent. He has been active in the field of fun science books for over 15 years, including the "Arienai Science" series, which has a cumulative total of 200,000 copies. He supervised science in the Weekly Shonen Jump series "[Dr. STONE](https://anilist.co/manga/98416/Dr-STONE/)" and is active as a bridge between fiction and real science.

He founded the science-based authors group "Yakuri Classroom of Doom (薬理凶室, Yakuri Kyoushitsu), known for publishing unorthodox science books and making various science-related videos.

**Genres:** Hip-hop, Funk, Jazz
